intro: Willoughbya nigricans, commonly known as the black willow or blackwood, is a tropical plant native to parts of Australia. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters in height. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery bloom. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically green or yellowish in color, and it produces small, fleshy fruits. Willoughbya nigricans is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing resilience to drought conditions.
